org.miness.jloglib
Class JLLSettings

java.lang.Object
  org.miness.jloglib.JLLSettings
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public final class JLLSettings
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

This class represents the settings of JLogLib.
It is a singleton, hence there's only one instance at runtime (held by this class itself).

Version:
1.0
Author:
Michel Neeser

allowSubLogLevels

public void allowSubLogLevels(boolean b)
Defines if sub log levels are allowed.
Example: If true and current log level is MEDIUM, then messages with log level MEDIUM and LOW are printed.
If false and current log level is MEDIUM, then only messages with log level MEDIUM are printed.

Parameters:
b - the boolean value to set.

getAllowSubLogLevels

public boolean getAllowSubLogLevels()
Returns the boolean which defines if sub log levels are allowed.
For more information, see Javadoc of allowSubLogLevels(boolean b).

Returns:
the currently set boolean value.

setLogTarget

public void setLogTarget(LogTarget target)
Sets the log target (CONSOLE or FILE).

Parameters:
target - the log target to set.

getLogTarget

public LogTarget getLogTarget()
Returns the log target which is currently set.
Attention: If the target is FILE but there's no file set, CONSOLE is returned.

Returns:
the current log target.

setLogFile

public void setLogFile(java.lang.String path)
Sets the log file (the file which is used for logging when the log target is FILE).

Parameters:
path - the path to the file on the file system.

setDelimiter

public void setDelimiter(java.lang.String delimiter)
Sets the delimiter for log entries.
E.g. the delimiter of "29.09.11 07:47 ==> Hello World" is "==>".

Parameters:
delimiter - the delimiter to set.

getDelimiter

public java.lang.String getDelimiter()
Returns the currently set delimiter.

Returns:
the delimiter.

setApplicationName

public void setApplicationName(java.lang.String name)
Sets the name of the application.
Used to print the name of the application in log messages (if getPrintApplicationName() is true).

Parameters:
name - the name to set.

getApplicationName

public java.lang.String getApplicationName()

the name of the application.
